definition: to invite/to provoke/to demand or ask for/to send armed forces to suppress/to denounce or condemn/to marry (a woman)/to discuss or study
"speech" or "words" radical in Chinese characters (Kangxi radical 149)/see also 言字旁[yan2 zi4 pang2]
to get the desired outcome/to win favor by fawning on sb/to curry favor with/a fruitful outcome to reward one's labor
to suppress by armed force/to send a punitive expedition against/to crusade against

sentences.english: When I please my boss, I am ass-kissing.
sentences.chinese: 当我讨上司欢心的时候，我是拍马屁。

sentences.english: Debt collectors buy old debts from companies or lenders for pennies on the dollar.
sentences.chinese: 债主从公司收旧账或者跟债务人讨小钱。

sentences.english: C. Discussion on Freshman English course for DFLL majors.
sentences.chinese: 有关检讨外文系大一英文课程案，提请讨論。

sentences.english: She bummed a dollar off me.
I'm sorry, I can't do for you, can only be myself.
sentences.chinese: 对不起，我做不到讨沵欢喜，只能做我自己。

sentences.english: He would like every man at this table to believe that he makes love to me .
sentences.chinese: 他是在让桌上的每个人都相信他在讨我的欢心。

sentences.english: If you want to win Tom's heart， make him a cheesecake.
sentences.chinese: 若是你想讨汤姆欢心，做起司蛋糕给他吃准没错。

sentences.english: He went to his neighbour to beg for some milk to feed the motherless baby.
sentences.chinese: 他找街坊邻居讨了一些牛奶来喂养那个没娘的孩子。

sentences.english: Actors powder with their left hands for luck.
sentences.chinese: 演员们为了讨吉利而用左手搽粉。

sentences.english: Discuss the use of thrombolysis in acute thrombophlebitis.
sentences.chinese: 讨血栓溶解治在急性血栓静脉炎之角色。

sentences.english: Demonstrate ability to manage amputation injuries and discuss the potential for reimplantation .
sentences.chinese: 有能处截肢性创伤与讨再接合的可能性。

sentences.english: He married his son to an architect's daughter.
sentences.chinese: 他替儿子讨了一个建筑师的女儿做老婆。

sentences.english: "I cannot placate the Left, " he grumbles .
sentences.chinese: 他不满地说，“我没法讨得左派的欢心”。

sentences.english: Chapter 7 looks at attempts to coordinate stockpiling policies internationally .
sentences.chinese: 第七章将论讨国际上协调库存政策的尝试。

sentences.english: She repeated the miser no hand to discuss wine.
sentences.chinese: 她屡次向吝啬鬼讨酒都没到手。

sentences.english: Ah Liu suddenly entered with a woeful look and asked for a tip.
sentences.chinese: 阿刘忽然进来，哭丧着脸向他讨小费。

definition: to get the desired outcome/to win favor by fawning on sb/to curry favor with/a fruitful outcome to reward one's labor
advantageous/favorable/to benefit at others' expense/to take unfair advantage
to report back after completion of one's mission
to adapt to sb's taste/to fit sb's fancy
to tell on sb/to complain (to a teacher, a superior etc)/to bring a lawsuit
to fawn on/to curry favor with/to make up to
roar of laughter (onom.)/hubbub/to roar (as a crowd)
to lose money instead of being paid (i.e. sb should pay me, but is actually taking my money)
to take the credit for sb's achievement
to ingratiate oneself with/to pander to
